main event: On September 17, 1957, in Columbus, Ohio, a civilian observed a white object the size of a basketball, oscillating or weaving from side to side for 15 to 30 minutes.
interesting points: The object was white, the size of a basketball, flat on the bottom, and rounded on top, exhibiting unusual movement for 15 to 30 minutes.
The observation was made by a civilian on the ground with close-ground radar and air viewed.
Despite the detailed observation, no report is on file regarding this sighting.
The sighting lasted for a relatively long duration of 15 to 30 minutes, allowing for a significant amount of data collection.
The conclusion of the investigation was deemed as 'Unknown', implying that no definitive explanation could be provided for the observed phenomenon.
sighted object: a white object the size of a basketball, oscillating or weaving from side to side
